titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Albert McCleery Papers PASC.0098
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections Staff, pre-1999; machine-readable finding aid created by Julie L. Graham and Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-07 14:12:45 -0700.

did.abstract: Producer and director Albert McCleery is best remembered for his theatre-in-the-round productions of television classics including Cameo Theater, Fireside Theatre, Hallmark Hall of Fame, and NBC Matinee Theatre. The collection consists primarily of television, and some radio scripts, along with production material, correspondence, and profession-related subject files. Among the projects represented are Cameo Theatre, CBS Television Workshop, Hallmark Hall of Fame, and NBC Matinee Theatre.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert McCleery Papers (Collection PASC 98). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections Staff, pre-1999.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID:
odd.p: UCLA Catalog Record ID: 9922213593606533

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Albert McCleery was born December 30, 1911 in Lawrence, Kentucky. He was a contract writer for Columbia Pictures (1940-41) and director of Fordham University Theatre (1949). McCleery is best remembered for his theatre-in-the-round productions of classics for television including Cameo Theater, Fireside Theatre, Hallmark Hall of Fame, and Matinee Theatre. He was also staff director in the NBC Television Programming Department (1949) and went on to become senior executive producer and director of Cameo Theatre. McCleery produced and directed for Hallmark Hall of Fame, devised NBC's Matinee Theater (1955), joined CBS (1959), and became producer of the CBS workshop. He died on May 13, 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material related to the career of producer and director, Albert McCleery. Primarily includes television scripts and some radio scripts along with production material, correspondence, and profession-related files that include resumes and photographs. Popular television roductions represented in the collection include Cameo Theatre (May-August 1950, January-March 1952, July-August 1955), CBS Television Workshop (January-December 1960), Fireside Theatre (June-October 1951), Hallmark Hall of Fame (July 1952-June 1955), The Kate Smith Hour (September 1951-June 1952), NBC's Matinee Theatre (October 1955-June 1958), and Your Prize Story (1952) among others. Radio scripts document the program Inheritance (April-September 1954). Also included are a small amount of personal files, materials representing unproduced projects, conferences and speaking engagements, and a small number of theatre-related files.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Television Projects
Radio Projects
Unproduced Projects
Correspondence
Professional Subject Files
Network Files
Theater Files
Conferences and Speaking Engagements
Personal Files

Collection of Scripts and Production Material for the Television Series NBC Matinee Theatre (Collection 1038). UCLA Library Special Collections.
Collection of Scripts for the Television Series The Further Adventures of Ellery Queen (Collection 1039). UCLA Special Collections, UCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Television Projects Series consists of material documenting McCleery's contributions to popular American television programing during the 1950s. Productions represented include Cameo Theatre, CBS Television Workshop, Fireside Theatre, Hallmark Hall of Fame, The Kate Smith Hour, NBC's Matinee Theatre, and Your Prize Story among others. The series is arranged alphabetically by program titles.

scopecontent.p: The series consists of files pertaining to unproduced projects created by and submitted to McCleery. Includes script material and occasional of budget information. The series is arranged alphabetically by projects created by McCleery and projects submitted to McCleery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the series consists of resumes, letters of application, and photographs from actors, directors, and production staff. Aslo includes a small amount of clippings on video technologies, a small number of items pertaining to the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, AFTRA and the Directors Guild.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Network Files are a small number of files pertaining to CBS and NBC. Among the files are publicity releases, inter-departmental communications, broad policy information, synopses, and a transcript of a Harry Reasoner interview for Vote for Me , among other network-related documents. The series is arranged alphabetically by file titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Theater Files include materials documenting McCleery's affiliation with the Pasadena Playhouse, Stage Magazine, Threshold Theatre, and educational theater. The series is arranged alphabetically by file titles.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and programs re. educational theater (22 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: With National Theatre Conference code, regulations, and objectives.

did.unittitle: Institute for Advanced Studies in the Theatre Arts - correspondence (3 items)
Letters and article by McCleery from his work at STAGE magazine (14 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Mostly concerning the Confederacy of American Community Theatres.

did.unittitle: PASADENA PLAYHOUSE alumni and ex-students name and addresses, program requirements and budget figures
PASADENA PLAYHOUSE Board of Trustees minutes and reports (Approximately 35 items)
Pasadena Playhouse College of Theatre Arts Application for Re- Accreditation

odd.head: General note
odd.p: With Report on Economic Study, and preliminary fiscal report.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Clipings on McCleery joining the Playhouse, play programs, schedules, and Proposal of Television Equipment.

did.unittitle: Publicity photographs of stage productions (Approximately 25 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Some appear to represent Fordham University.

did.unittitle: Theatre School Ion - catalogue and brochures
THRESHOLD THEATRE proposal, budgets and contracts (21 items)
Yale and the IVY Radio Network - correspondence (11 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: With prospectus from Ivy Network.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series documents assorted conferences and speaking engagements in which McCleery may have been present at such as American Educational Theatre Association, Armed Forces Television Conference and Westinghouse Educational Television Conference among others. Additionally there is University of British Columbia correspondence and photographs of McCleery working at the University and transcript of speech Theater's Debt to Television . The series is arranged alphabetically by event or location name.

did.unittitle: Albert McCleery photographs, invitations and speech transcript (7 items).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Three photographs of Mccleery (conference unknown), two invitations for appearances, and transcript of speech "Theater's Debt to Television".

did.unittitle: American Educational Theatre Association conference schedule, membership directory, reports and correspondence (9 items)
CBS Television Workshop Seminar questionnaires (56 items)
Seventh Annual Summer Television Workshop (Michigan State) notebook (1 item).
Syracuse University correspondence and Speech Association of the Eastern States convention program (4 items)
Third Annual Armed Forces Television Conference brochures (7 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: On the role of television within the Army and Air Force.

did.unittitle: Third Annual Armed Forces Television Conference schedule of TV presentations, brochures on TV as an instructional medium and its role in the armed forces (9 items)
TV Code Committee and High School of Art and Design letters regarding appearances (2 items)
University of British Columbia correspondence and photographs of McCleery working at the University (20 items)
Westinghouse Educational Television Conference correspondence and schedule (16 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: With brochures from WQED, WQEX, and KQED television stations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Personal Files series consists of memorabilia, notes for what appears to be a possible lecture, material related to Fordham University, and information regarding McCleery's credits.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Correspondence and lists on bills, money received, expenditures and other personal accounting matters. Approximately 45 items.

did.unittitle: Albert McCleery credits and biographies (13 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Emmy Awards programs and entry forms, Institute Of Education By Radio-TV award, NBC MATINEE THEATRE, CAMEO THEATRE, INHERITANCE memorabilia. 1950's, 1960's. 20 items.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Programs, clippings, exams, scripts, and correspondence relating to the University. 25 items.

did.unittitle: Invitations for a party given by McCleery (4 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Bills, lease, and correspondence relating to rental apartment. Ca. 30 items.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Assets, correspondence and legal materials relating to the company and its Macloren Playhouse. 21 items.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Credit cards, clipping, Christmas money pool with Stephen Sondheim and Joseph Chaikin.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Personal notes (class, lecture?) on theater, literature, debate. [1930?]. Approximately 20 items.

did.unittitle: Party bills, menu and list of guests for two parties given by McCleery
Photographs of McCleery as a young man, wedding and from friends (18 items)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Lists of names and telephone numbers of McCleery's friends and colleagues in Southern California. 1963. 6 items.
